channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AK

item.title: Report X-2023111314
item.description:
Report X-2023111314

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: FAI
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023111314: [REDACTED - GEM/DATAOPS] was shipping out 5 totes plus one other item. When our ramp agent was helping unload the totes onto a cart, the ramp agent asked if there were any hazardous, dangerous, flammable, lithium batteries. The customer stated there were not. Cargo agent building the AWB also asked about batteries since he stated their were power tools. Customer stated no. When asked the check sheet questions "I certify that this cargo does not contain any unauthorized explosives, incendiaries, individuals, or other destructive substances or items. I am aware that this endorsement and original signature, and other shipping documents, will be retained on file for a minimum of 30 days from date of transport from accepting station." the customer verbally verified. After x-raying the totes, a handgun and ammunition as well as other possible items were seen. Searched all of the totes and found multiple spare lithium ion batteries per tote, handwarmers, handgun, ammunition, batteries, a dwalt btu propane burner that still smelled of propane All would have flown on Passenger AC X-2023111315: [REDACTED - GEM/DATAOPS] was shipping out 5 totes plus one other item. Cargo agent building the AWB also asked about batteries since he stated their were power tools. Customer stated no. When asked the check sheet questions "I certify that this cargo does not contain any unauthorized explosives, incendiaries, individuals, or other destructive substances or items. I am aware that this endorsement and original signature, and other shipping documents, will be retained on file for a minimum of 30 days from date of transport from accepting station." the customer verbally verified. After x-raying the totes, a handgun and ammunition as well as other possible items were seen. Searched all of the totes and found multiple spare lithium ion batteries per tote, handwarmers, handgun, ammunition, batteries, a dwalt btu propane burner that still smelled of propane All would have gone on passenger aircraft X-2023111316: [REDACTED - GEM/DATAOPS] was shipping out 5 totes plus one other item.
